sn25.2:1: At Sāvatthī. "Bhikkhus, forms are impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise. Sounds … Odours … Tastes … Tactile objects … Mental phenomena are impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise.sn.iii.226One who places faith in these teachings and resolves on them thus is called a faith-follower, one who has entered the fixed course of rightness … ; he is incapable of passing away without having realized the fruit of stream-entry.
sn25.2:2: "One for whom these teachings are accepted thus after being pondered to a sufficient degree with wisdom is called a Dhamma-follower, one who has entered the fixed course of rightness … ; he is incapable of passing away without having realized the fruit of stream-entry.
